title: Land Access for Beginning Farmers Part II

tasks.task: Performing physical tasks related to assessing farmland and studying rental or purchase options.
subtasks: Listening to the presenters and taking notes.
Participating in the Q&A session by typing questions in the chat box.
Using the chat box to indicate state of origin.
Following instructions to engage in web activities like taking a survey.

tasks.task: Evaluating land access options and readiness to lease or purchase land.
subtasks: Assessing natural features of the land, such as soils, topography, water sources, and climate.
Evaluating infrastructure and existing structures on the land.
Calculating potential costs associated with owning or leasing the land.
Considering family values and compatibility with farm goals.
Determining if land access is the primary limiting factor for farm business growth.
Researching tax implications and opportunities for land use in farming.
Comparing current use tax programs and other financial benefits.
Rewarding or repairing farm buildings and infrastructure.
Installing or maintaining septic systems or other necessary utilities.
Engaging in soil testing and analysis.
Evaluating zoning regulations and potential building permits.
Negotiating lease agreements or purchase terms with landowners.
Determining appropriate cash rental rates based on market research.
